predictions.text: Waymo will publicly confirm it has resumed offering paid driverless robotaxi rides to the general public in San Francisco by 2026-02-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Waymo (or Alphabet) posts an official update (blog, press statement, in-app notice, or regulator filing cited by major media) stating that its driverless commercial ride-hail service is operating again in San Francisco for members of the public (not employees-only testing).
monitoring_signals: Waymo SF service-area map/status page changes
CPUC/DMV notices about Waymo SF operations
Local media reports of Waymo One reopening to SF riders
predictions.rationale: The reported pause was tied to flood warnings; operational suspensions for weather are typically temporary, making resumption within ~7 weeks more likely than a prolonged halt absent a safety/regulatory shock.

predictions.text: CISA will add CVE-2025-68664 (LangChain/LangChain-core) to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: CISA’s official KEV Catalog (or CISA alert announcing catalog updates) includes an entry for CVE-2025-68664 by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: CISA KEV RSS/JSON feed updates
Vendor advisories and exploit PoC/public exploitation reports
Mentions of active exploitation in major incident-response writeups
predictions.rationale: If exploitation is observed in real-world intrusions, CISA often adds widely used dependency vulnerabilities to KEV; timing depends on confirmation of exploitation at scale.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Defense (or U.S. Africa Command) will publicly announce at least one additional kinetic strike/operation in Nigeria targeting ISIS-linked militants by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: An official DoD/AFRICOM press release, briefing transcript, or statement confirms a U.S. strike/raid in Nigeria against ISIS/ISWAP or ISIS-linked militants after 2025-12-26 and by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: AFRICOM press releases and briefings
Reuters/AP reporting citing U.S. officials on Sahel/West Africa operations
Security incident spikes involving ISWAP/Boko Haram prompting U.S. response
predictions.rationale: A recent strike increases the base rate of follow-on actions if ISR/targeting pipelines remain active, but political constraints and host-nation dynamics keep probability moderate.

predictions.text: The EU and/or U.S. will announce at least $1.0 billion in new funding commitments specifically for Ukraine electricity/grid/heat/water infrastructure repair or resilience by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A European Commission, EU member-state coalition, U.S. government agency (State/USAID/DoE), or G7-aligned joint announcement commits ≥$1.0B (new money, not re-labeled prior funds) explicitly earmarked for Ukraine energy/utilities infrastructure.
monitoring_signals: EU Commission and EBRD/EIB Ukraine support announcements
USAID/State Department Ukraine energy resilience press releases
Ukrenergo/Ukraine government statements about donor packages
predictions.rationale: Sustained winter targeting raises urgency for large, earmarked utility-resilience packages; the main uncertainty is whether commitments clear the $1B threshold before late winter ends.

predictions.text: FEMA will approve federal Individual Assistance (IA) or Public Assistance (PA) for at least one Southern California county due to the post-Christmas flooding by 2026-02-28 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FEMA’s official disaster declaration/notice lists IA or PA authorized for one or more Southern California counties in connection with the late-December 2025 flooding event.
monitoring_signals: California OES requests for federal assistance
FEMA disaster declaration database updates
Damage estimates from counties and Caltrans/utility outage data
predictions.rationale: Major metro-area flooding frequently triggers PA/IA, but outcomes depend on assessed damage thresholds and state/federal coordination speed.

predictions.text: The California Department of Insurance will approve a homeowners insurance rate increase of at least 20% for at least one top-10 U.S. home insurer (by premiums) for its California book, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A CDI rate approval notice (or insurer/CDI public filing) shows an approved homeowners rate change with an indicated average increase ≥20% for a top-10 U.S. homeowners insurer operating in California.
monitoring_signals: CDI SERFF filings and rate-approval announcements
Insurer earnings calls citing California rate actions
Wildfire/flood loss trends and reinsurance pricing at renewals
predictions.rationale: California catastrophe exposure and reinsurance costs create strong upward rate pressure; approval magnitude is uncertain but large increases have become more common.

predictions.text: A bill creating a federal income-tax deduction (or credit) for consumer auto-loan interest will be introduced in either chamber of the U.S. Congress by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Congress.gov shows introduction of a bill whose text establishes an above-the-line deduction, itemized deduction, or tax credit explicitly tied to interest paid on qualified personal-use vehicle loans.
monitoring_signals: House Ways & Means / Senate Finance member press releases
Tax-policy draft packages and reconciliation chatter
Auto-industry lobbying and coalition letters
predictions.rationale: Public discussion of an auto-loan tax break raises likelihood of legislative drafting, but enactment prospects and timing are uncertain, keeping confidence modest.

predictions.text: COMEX silver futures (front-month) will settle at or above $32.00/oz at least once by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: CME/COMEX official settlement data (or widely cited market data providers reflecting CME settlements) show a front-month silver futures settlement price ≥ $32.00/oz on at least one trading day by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Dollar real-rate moves and Fed policy expectations
ETFs (SLV) net inflows and positioning data (CFTC COT)
Industrial-demand indicators and China macro surprises
predictions.rationale: Recent strength raises the chance of a further upside test; however, silver’s volatility and sensitivity to real yields keep the probability below 50%.

predictions.text: The U.S. EPA will publish a funding solicitation (NOFO/RFP) offering at least $50 million total for PFAS destruction/destruction-technology pilots or demonstrations by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: EPA (or grants.gov for an EPA program) posts an official NOFO/RFP where eligible activities include PFAS destruction (not only filtration) and the total available funding stated is ≥ $50,000,000.
monitoring_signals: EPA press releases on PFAS strategy and technology demonstrations
grants.gov searches for EPA + PFAS + destruction
State water-utility coalitions advocating for destruction pilots
predictions.rationale: If claimed destruction advances are credible, EPA has incentives to accelerate pilots; budget/process constraints and competing PFAS priorities make a ≥$50M dedicated solicitation uncertain.

predictions.text: NOAA will issue a 2026 Atlantic hurricane seasonal outlook that calls for an 'above-normal' season (per NOAA’s categorical language) by 2026-05-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: NOAA/NHC/CPC publishes the official 2026 Atlantic hurricane season outlook and the categorical summary states 'above-normal' (not 'near-normal' or 'below-normal').
monitoring_signals: ENSO forecasts (La Niña/El Niño) for Aug–Oct 2026
Atlantic MDR SST anomalies and vertical wind shear outlooks
NOAA spring outlook briefings and pre-season statements
predictions.rationale: Recent warm-ocean conditions tilt outlooks toward above-normal, but ENSO uncertainty and NOAA’s multi-factor framework keep confidence only moderately above a coin flip.
